docs.snippet: Betsy Bloomingdale, a department store heir's widow who hobnobbed with the world's elite, epitomized high fashion and was best friends with former first lady Nancy Reagan, has died. She was 93....
docs.lead_paragraph: Betsy Bloomingdale, a department store heir's widow who hobnobbed with the world's elite, epitomized high fashion and was best friends with former first lady Nancy Reagan, has died. She was 93.

docs.snippet: Shares of Nintendo rose as much as 7 percent on Friday, erasing earlier losses after players reported the company's blockbuster mobile phone game Pokemon GO had been released in Japan....

docs.snippet: An Arizona teenager jailed on charges of plotting to bomb a public building suffers from autism, with the mental capacity of someone younger than 13 and a "limited ability to function on his own," his parents said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Arizona teenager jailed on charges of plotting to bomb a public building suffers from autism, with the mental capacity of someone younger than 13 and a "limited ability to function on his own," his parents said on Thursday.

headline.main: Mental Age of Accused Arizona 'Jihadist' Is Less Than 13, Parents Say

docs.snippet: Chants of "All Lives Matter!" filled the arena at the Republican National Convention Thursday — a not-so-subtle jab at the Black Lives Matter movement that calls attention to police violence against African-Americans....

docs.snippet: Francisco Liriano doesn't believe he's lost his stuff so much as he's misplaced it. The search to find it over the last few weeks sent the veteran Pittsburgh Pirates pitcher to the bullpen for lengthy sessions with pitching coach Ray Searage....

docs.snippet: “Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme,” Molière’s 1670 comedy, is being presented as part of the Lincoln Center Festival by a French company....
docs.lead_paragraph: “Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme,” Molière’s 1670 comedy, is being presented as part of the Lincoln Center Festival by a French company.
docs.abstract: Elizabeth Vincentelli reviews CICT/Theatre des Bouffes du Nord production of Moliere play Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme, directed by Denis Podalydes, as part of Lincoln Center Festival at Gerald W Lynch Theater at John Jay College.

headline.main: Review: Rich, Crude and Craving Acceptance in 17th-Century France
